name: Vietnamese Shrimp and Pork Egg Rolls (Chả Giò Cuốn Tôm Thịt)
description: Crispy little packets of savoriness, these are one of my favorite dishes to make during the holidays. These appetizers are a combination of traditional Vietnamese egg rolls and whole shrimp. Carry a basket of these bad boys to a dinner party and you’ll be the life of the party… or at least until they run out. This recipe makes 28 egg rolls.
keywords: vietnamese shrimp ground pork egg rolls, vietnamese shrimp ground pork egg roll, shrimp ground pork egg rolls, shrimp ground pork spring roll, shrimp ground pork spring roll recipe, crispy shrimp ground pork egg roll, crispy shrimp ground pork egg roll, vietnamese appetizer, vietnamese crispy spring roll appetizer, vietnamese crispy egg roll appetizer, how to make vietnamese shrimp and ground pork egg roll appetizer, how to make vietnamese shrimp and ground pork spring roll appetizer, shrimp and ground pork egg rolls, how to make shrimp and ground pork egg rolls, vietnamese shrimp and ground pork egg roll recipe, easy homemade shrimp and ground pork egg roll, easy homemade shrimp and ground pork spring roll, shrimp and ground pork egg roll tutorial, how to wrap shrimp ground pork egg roll, how to wrap shrimp ground pork spring roll, shrimp and ground pork egg rolls recipe, authentic shrimp and ground pork egg rolls recipe, authentic vietnamese shrimp and ground pork egg roll recipe, shrimp and ground pork egg roll recipe, shrimp and ground pork egg rolls recipe, cha gio cuon tom thit, cha gio tom thit, Chả Giò Cuốn Tôm Thịt, Chả Giò Tôm Thịt, vietnamese home cooking recipes
recipeIngredient: 1 package egg roll / lumpia / spring roll wrapper (1 lb)
Bottled sweet chili dipping sauce or make your own
recipeInstructions: Peel and devein the shrimp. Leave the tail for a "handle" for a more beautiful presentation.
Set aside 10 shrimp (no tail) for the pork mixture.
In a small bowl, season shrimp with tails with oyster sauce and sugar.
Mince the reserved 10 shrimp into a paste and combine with ground pork in a bowl.
Season the ground pork mixture with green onion, oyster sauce, sugar, sesame oil and black pepper.
Assemble the egg rolls. See step-by-step picture above.
In a wok or large skillet, add about 2 inches of oil and heat to 325°F.
Add as many egg rolls that can fit without overcrowding.
Deep fry for about 4 minutes per batch. Transfer egg rolls to a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to drain off excess oil.
Serve immediately for best results with a sweet chili dipping sauce.
